entry.title: Me
entry.content: Ranjith is a name that carries an aura of mystery and intrigue, often associated with qualities like victory and delight in its Sanskrit roots. Imagine Ranjith as a shadowy figure—someone who moves silently through the tapestry of life, leaving behind a trail of curiosity without revealing much about himself. The essence of this mysterious individual lies in the unknown, evoking a sense of fascination and wonder in those who hear the name but know little else. In the vast expanse of stories and legends, Ranjith could embody the enigma that invites others to wonder what adventures, secrets, and depths lie beneath the surface of such a name. This mysterious persona can be envisioned as someone both elusive and captivating, whose true story remains hidden, waiting to be discovered by those patient enough to seek it.
entry.summary: Ranjith is a name that carries an aura of mystery and intrigue, often associated with qualities like victory and delight in its Sanskrit roots. Imagine Ranjith as a shadowy figure—someone who moves silently through the tapestry of life, leaving behind a trail of curiosity without revealing much about himself. entry.title: Kiwifruit
entry.content:
Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

The most common cultivar group of kiwifruit is oval, about the size of a large hen’s egg (5–8 cm (2.0–3.1 in) in length and 4.5–5.5 cm (1.8–2.2 in) in diameter). It has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture, with a sweet and unique flavor.
entry.summary: Kiwifruit (often abbreviated as kiwi), or Chinese gooseberry is the edible berry of several species of woody vines in the genus Actinidia.

entry.title: Apples
entry.content:
An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

Apple trees are cultivated worldwide, and are the most widely grown species in the genus Malus. The tree originated in Central Asia, where its wild ancestor, Malus sieversii, is still found today. Apples have been grown for thousands of years in Asia and Europe, and were brought to North America by European colonists.
entry.summary: An apple is a sweet, edible fruit produced by an apple tree.
